name: Beef Pad See Ew Recipe (Thai Rice Noodles)
description: This beef pad see ew recipe comes together in just 20 minutes. Quick, easy, and delicious!

video.name: Letâ€™s make some Thai food, pad see ew! #thaifood #stirfrynoodles #padseeew #food #isan

recipeIngredient: 18 ounces fresh wide rice noodles (approx 10-12 oz dry rice noodles)
7 ounces beef (thinly sliced against the grain)
7 ounces Chinese broccoli (peel and slice the stems, roughly chop the leaves)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the fresh rice noodles and dark soy sauce in a small bowl. If you have one, use a plastic glove and your hand to gently toss the noodles with the sauces without breaking them.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the fresh rice noodles and dark soy sauce in a small bowl. If you have one, use a plastic glove and your hand to gently toss the noodles with the sauces without breaking them.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large non-stick pan or skillet over high heat. Add oil and introduce the garlic, frying until it's golden. Then, add the beef slices and stir-fry until it's about halfway cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large non-stick pan or skillet over high heat. Add oil and introduce the garlic, frying until it's golden. Then, add the beef slices and stir-fry until it's about halfway cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Push everything to one side of the pan and crack the eggs into the other half. Gently scramble the eggs and then mix them with the beef.
recipeInstructions.name: Push everything to one side of the pan and crack the eggs into the other half. Gently scramble the eggs and then mix them with the beef.

recipeInstructions.text: Add seasonings and sauces: oyster sauce, white sugar, flavor seasoning, white pepper, and vinegar. Toss and mix until all noodles are coated with the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Add seasonings and sauces: oyster sauce, white sugar, flavor seasoning, white pepper, and vinegar. Toss and mix until all noodles are coated with the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Chinese broccoli and onions to the stir-fry and mix until the vegetables reach the texture of your preference (soft or crunchy). I prefer the broccoli stems with a slight crunch, so I typically stir-fry for less than a minute. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Chinese broccoli and onions to the stir-fry and mix until the vegetables reach the texture of your preference (soft or crunchy). I prefer the broccoli stems with a slight crunch, so I typically stir-fry for less than a minute. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Hey Tyson, I used plain white vinegar, let me know how it turned out. Thanks and enjoy!
Hi there, I was wanting to try this recipe today. What kind of vinegar do you use? Just plain white vinegar, or rice vinegar, or something else?
Hey JO, RosDee is a Thai brand like "Knorr" in Western countries. They make bouillon / flavor seasonings.

keywords: beef pad see ew, pad see ew beef, thai rice noodles
